metadata.title: CVE-2018-5710 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. Thepre-defined function "strlen" is getting a "NULL" string as a parametervalue in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the KeyDistribution Center (KDC), which allows remote authenticated users to causea denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a modified kadminclient.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5710` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.19.2-2
krb5-gss-samples - 1.19.2-2
krb5-k5tls - 1.19.2-2
krb5-kdc - 1.19.2-2
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.19.2-2
krb5-kpropd - 1.19.2-2
krb5-locales - 1.19.2-2
krb5-multidev - 1.19.2-2
krb5-otp - 1.19.2-2
krb5-pkinit - 1.19.2-2
krb5-user - 1.19.2-2
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.19.2-2
libgssrpc4 - 1.19.2-2
libk5crypto3 - 1.19.2-2
libkadm5clnt-mit12 - 1.19.2-2
libkadm5srv-mit12 - 1.19.2-2
libkdb5-10 - 1.19.2-2
libkrad0 - 1.19.2-2
libkrb5-3 - 1.19.2-2
libkrb5support0 - 1.19.2-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: krb5 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.19.2-2').
